summary: The FEMA Loan Interest Payment Relief Act amends the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to allow the government to reimburse local governments and electric cooperatives for interest expenses on qualifying loans used for disaster relief efforts. This includes defining 'qualifying interest' and 'qualifying loans,' as well as outlining procedures for reimbursement and setting deadlines for the FEMA Administrator to establish new reimbursement procedures and initiate payments.
